reviewText: J'ai regardé toute la série des MAIGRET durant l'été, excepté le 9e coffret pas encore sorti,et j'ai beaucoup aimé.Ayant vu quelques épisodes de la série avec MICHAEL GAMBON et celle avec JEAN RICHARD,je peux dire que BRUNO CREMER est le meilleur dans le rle du commissaire.Le coffret trois est mon préféré, parce qu'on peut y voir de très bons acteurs de soutien comme CLAUDE PIÉPLU,JEAN YANNE,BERNADETTE LAFONT et ODETTE LAURE.Donc,si vous en achetez seulement un,achetez celui-là.On peut enlever les sous-titres anglais si cela dérange le visionnement.

reviewText: My favourite fiction detective, Georges Simenon's "Maigret" continues on in these terrific full-length features based on the actual novels.  Bruno Cremer has so successfully merged himself into Maigret that now I can't imagine anyone else playing the role.  One of my favourite characters from the books,  Torrence,  is also delightfully played by Eric Prat.  As devotees of Simenon will attest, these mystery stories are character driven with intricate plotting.  They are not shoot-em-ups or simple good versus evil stories.  Stick with these ingenious stories and you won't be disappointed.  Take for instance  Episode 15: "Maigret's War of Nerves" one of the first  ever Maigret's, originally published in book form in 1931 as "La Tete d'un homme"; it is an absolute gem.  Been updated to the 50's and mainly set in  an upmarket  Parisian café-restaurant, Jules Maigret cleverly solves  (as only Maigret can)  a very complex case by keen and witty observation whilst puffing on his pipe and being introduced to a few Manhattan cocktails. Full of fascinating characters and  nothing is ever what it appears to be.  You can have your Hercule Poirets and Miss Marples, I'll stick with my friend Jules Maigret!  And while on the subject of fictional detectives, I wonder if we will ever see the great German series "Derrick" starring Horst Tappert as the very stylish Munich inspector ever come to DVD.  How about some detective work, MHZ Networks, to get these available for purchase?
summary: MAIGRET: LIKE GOOD FRENCH WINE - WORTH SAVORING!

reviewText: For the real Maigret, I highly recommend the versions starring the (now deceased) actor Bruno Cremer. Outstanding casting and location work. This is also the most extensive series of the Simenon Maigret stories.

reviewText: The episodes in Series 3 continue to be suspenseful. Maigret's close-to-the-vest manner of investigating keeps you guessing until the end.

reviewText: Maigret is the best detective hands down. He is an individual who treats everybody with respect including the culprits. His quiet investigation techniques are seemless and feel natural. Maigret is the originial detective. To the reader: do not buy anything over Maigret! You may be wanting to buy Montalbano. DO NOT!!!! Montalbano is a supposed detective, but he sleeps with all the suspects he meets and is used by everybody. I have watched all the episodes and that is true for all of them. Also Maigret is the best buy because you get 6 90 minute episodes. The Montalbano DVDs only come with at most 4 episodes. Truly you are being effed up the behind when you buy anything but Maigret......See you topsideP.S. This is a confirmed amazon purchase as you can see above. Dont believes the haters.
